review: We just left Red Robin soft opening in their new location at Patriot Place it is absolutely beautiful they did such a great job they actually have a garage door that opens out to a patio that overlooks the Patriots Stadium . Everything was terrific the food was served piping hot we ordered burgers well done they were perfect couldn't fault a thing everything was spot on! Bartenders and waitstaff are extremely friendly. Congratulations on your new location it's really EXCEPTIONAL! ........JOB WELL DONE. Red Robin corporate should be very pleased, so well organized  for a new location. The manager, Pat obviously  worked very hard to make this new location and opening a great success. I would highly recommend  this restaurant can not wait to go back.

Bar flies, crappy service and overcooked, greasy hamburgers. That should be the new tag line for this location. You suck.  I love red robin but this location is the worst! There seems to be much better choices in this area. Do yourself a favor and pick one of those. Don't go here.

My family and I come here (at the old location) often enough that we know what to order by the time we get there.  We were taken by surprise that there was a change of location, so we went to the new location and it looked VERY different than it did before. It seemed to be more modern, flashy, and smaller.  We had 4 people and a stroller, and were placed in a small booth when there were PLENTY of other places with larger amounts of table space. As for food, we usually order the onion ring tower. First few onion rings were great, until we got towards the bottom and I noticed a bitter, burnt flavor to the batter... My cousin agreed that the rings were over cooked. I got the guacamole bacon burger, MEDIUM WELL. Take a few bites of my burger to see that my burger was definitely well done, so well that the sides of my burger was burnt. There was a burnt aftertaste, after each bite I take.  The waitress was cool, she forgot some things we asked for (like lemon for my water) but I lived, not a big deal. I would've given my experience here a 1 but I've been coming to Red Robins for awhile now, and maybe their new location needs some getting use to? Or I just had bad luck, who knows.

Where do I start? Me & my husband had a gift certificate and ended up trying out the new red robin location tonight at Patriots Place we had enjoyed it before with our 3 sons. I opened the front door and there was a sharp piece of trim under the door that brushed my toe and cut my toenail in half! Yup I'm half. I stood in the lobby and told the 2 hostesses about it, they watched my toe bleed for minutes one of them even saying the blood is a puddle on your sandle now...before I asked for a band aid. I was waiting for my husband and was sat. Never asked again how my toe was. None of the staff had a smile, the outside deck area had a wash cloth they were ringing out in a bucket on the ground to wash the tables...Gross! Also on the ground was the busboy bucket that piled up on a Revolution soccer night. Service was super slow and super unfriendly. I went to the women's restroom which was directly across from the men's room which obviously isn't the issue. The men's room smelled so bad it had had a 'problem' and the mop was at the entrance, door open stinking out to the restaurant... gross!  Attention management: work with your staff, they are not happy. Attention Staff: I am a customer and matter, come check on me and your other customers don't make annoyed faces when a family comes and you need to combine tables!  I hope better luck next time if there is one.

Ok so I  went Sunday after work to have a great burger and found out they had relocated found it near Olympia sports. It looks amazing and takes up a corner with outside tables flat screen tvs and colored wooden brick panels!! I really love the way it looks! You walk in from 2 doors and there are at least 2 hostesses and they will seat you quick! We chose to sit outside because it was about 7 15 and still a gorgeous day at like 80 degrees with shade. So I ordered a great double angus burger with their bottomless garlic and herb Fries with a strawberry lemonade!! Can you say delicious? The burger was thick and tasty and the lemonade  was on point I will def return to this new red robin but they need to hire better help. Oh did I mention they were out of onion rings? What a bummer!

My Wife & I went to the Patriots preseason game last night and after seeing tons of Red Robin commercials, we decided this was the best time to give it a shot.  We got there and they told us the wait was going to be about 30 mins so we went to the bar to grab a couple beers while we waited.  Got large glasses at a great price.  Table was ready in 20... Great! Service was good, our waitress was pretty quick to take our order and bring out our second round.  I ordered the Pepper & Smoke Burger (their "Ultra premium" offering) and my wife got the BBQ Burger of some sort.   Things started to fall apart at this point... My wife ordered no Mayo on her burger and low and behold... it not only had mayo but a lot of it.  She got the onion rings with it b/c they were out of Sweet Potato fries... and she only got like 6 rings with it and they were not refillable. My burger was okay... I ordered it medium rare but it came out as Medium to Medium-Well... which in hindsight was fine with me b/c I'm not sure how "premium" the meat really was (in which case... torch that f*er).  Their bottomless steak fries were also just okay... they give you such a small portion of them that you end up ordering a second (especially b/c my wife finished her onion rings super quick).  Also got a side of cole slaw, which I enjoyed but you literally got 3 bites in a serving. All and All... not a great Red Robin experience.  If I'm going to pay 12.99 for a burger... it damn well better be an A+ burger.  I can go to some really upscale gastro-pubs in Boston and get a better offering for less $.  No complaints about service though... probably the only redeeming quality here.

Always been a fan with their burgers. Very modern and trendy especially with its new location overlooking the stadium. Overall really good service. I was pleased with my veggie burger. I found the menu to be a tad intense since their earlier days of a simple diner type menu. The menu is a booklet with way too many options.

I took a group of nearly 30 campers out for lunch, and it went wonderfully! I had let them know we were coming in advance, but we ended up arriving about half an hour earlier than I had anticipated. The hostess was very friendly and we were seated quickly. Waiter was also super friendly, and we were served quickly, especially considering there were over 30 people between campers and counselors. The kids definitely enjoyed their meals as well as all of the crazy decor on display. The final icing on the cake was the bill, way lower than I had anticipated! I would definitely recommend Red Robin if you are looking to feed and entertain your kids for a reasonable price.

Tried the new location tonight and we were disappointed. Slow service, pushing the table top ziosk, forgetting utensils and napkins and not bringing them until five minutes after the food arrived. I don't go out to eat and expect to order remotely. That's why the job title is "server". Went to pay my bill with a Benjamin and was asked if I wanted change twice! We usually enjoy it here but this experience could be the last time we visit.

I have been to this Red Robin location a few times, and it's never impressing. The major issue here is the size of the restaurant (which may have be fixed now that they moved...), there is always a wait on weekends and weekdays (from certain hours), and the waiting area is always JAMMED. Then when your wait is finally over, and always over later than expected, the tables aren't normally cleaned to perfection. Just average. The food is good, specifically burgers and those cool onion ring towers, yet my experiences here have not been the same as the Millbury Red Robin, which is particularly better. Food is quicker, more gourmet, and there wasn't a wait at all on a Saturday (impossible here). Hopefully the new Red Robin in the South Shore Plaza will not be like this! 2 stars. UPDATE : Feb. 14, 2016 : Was hoping to revisit the Patriot Place Red Robin on Valentine's Day for Lunch, see if it has gotten any better since my last eh-eh visit. Website indicated NOTHING about closing.  So drove up here to find it closed, because of "technical issues". Won't ever be returning. With both Millbury & Braintree Red Robin locations, there is no way I'll ever fall for the un-reliability of the Patriot Place location. Too bad. 1 star.

This was my first time at the new location, and it was a relatively good experience. My one complaint was the service at the front when we came in. There was a wait, as expected since it's a busy location, but the staff were very disorganized about it. None of the three people seemed to know what was going on, and two of them tried to seat us at the same time.  Other than that, our service was fantastic. Our waitress was very friendly and knew what we needed before we even asked for it. My fiancee and I ordered a burger to split, and she brought two plates and cut it in half without us requesting it, which was great. We had the Whiskey River Burger, which is my go to at Red Robin, and it was delicious, as always. I also highly recommend getting the campfire sauce to go with your bottomless fries. It's pretty much my favorite condiment of all time.  I'm not a huge fan of the updated decor and menu, but the food is still great, so it's worth a visit if you can get past the service on the front end.

Boyfriend and I came here before we attended the Monday night patriots game (11/23). Obviously, it was busy... Not a big deal. Put our names on the wait, they told us 15 minutes, but never asked our preference in seating... I only say this because when our table was ready at 15 minutes, the hostess brought us over to our table which was in a side room near the bar area, that was located where they have the outside patio seating... Mind you its 30 degrees, and they have the "garage door" OPEN, and our table is literally placed right in front of the wide open area, so the freezing cold air and wind was coming in... She drops off the menus and run... At this point, i am beyond upset that they didn't even ask when I put my name on the wait "do you have a preference in where you sit?".  I would have gladly asked to NOT sit in this area, considering we came for dinner to get out of the 30 degree weather, as we were going to be sitting out in it for 4 hours!!! Another thing that REALLY bothered me was, there weren't any heaters located near us to make the cold a little bearable... Only reason why we even decided to sit was, I overheard the host tell the next table besides us, that if they wanted to wait for another table (not in this area), it would be another 20 minutes, because they would be put back on the wait, instead of giving the next available table...  We ordered our food from our server Carlos, who was very nice, but could tell he was a bit overwhelmed, don't blame him one bit, it was crazy in there and his tables were so close together, he could barely move!!!  After sitting at this terrible table for about 15, my boyfriend couldn't handle it anymore, and asked a bartender very nicely if they could please shut the garage door to the outside, as no one was sitting out there. Her response was "I'm sorry we can't, because in a while, everyone will be sitting out there..." This really bothered me because it felt like this restaurant was more concerned about packing bodies in, and making all the money they can, instead of making sure their "guests" feel comfortable, and aren't freezing while waiting for a warm meal... Hence the reason why coming to a restaurant to get out of the cold for a while... A table in the corner of the same room that we were in, had opened up, and we asked to move over there. Carlos said go right ahead, and I apologized for moving, i just couldn't handle the cold coming in directly on my face, he was completely understanding of us moving. About 15 minutes later, we received our food. Sadly I didn't get the burger I originally ordered... But I ate it anyways because I was so hungry! Either way, I was pleased with my meal, and my boyfriend was happy with his. By the time we ended up leaving there were only two tables outside at this time and they were just drinking... I am sorry for this lengthy review, but I firmly believe that if you are going to have wide open doors to freezing cold weather, you may want to WARN your PAYING guests of where they may be sitting, or even have HEATERS available so that there is some kind of relief from the 30 degree weather... Carlos is only reason why this place is even getting 2 stars from me...

Love that they've moved to a new location and made the bar separate from the dining room! My boyfriend and I enjoy eating in the bar section whenever we go out to eat, before they moved we felt awkward with all the families being in perfect view. Loved the whiskey river barbecue chicken wrap, and the decor is great! ..Servers were mehh, but we weren't in a rush so didn't really mind the slow service and lack of friendliness that time.

You'd think that a giant location like this would have their shit together, being in Patriot Place and all, but you would be mistaken. We were seated in the bar area and basically ignored for about 10 minutes. I should've taken this a sign to head somewhere else, but my aunt and I had our hearts set on a burger, so we stayed. Our server seemed like he didn't want to be there, and the food followed suit. A burger with "some pink" came out so overcooked that it was black on one side, and the server didn't come back for another 10 minutes so I didn't even have a chance to send it back. And the "bottomless" fries are a bit of a myth when your server doesn't check up on you after you've finished your entire meal. This was just a really poor experience, and I won't be heading back to this particular location again.

Much like my previous review,  I've returned again to be told by the server that they couldn't make two different drinks that we ordered. How in hell does this bar make any money?  Weekends,  weekdays,  it doesn't matter,  they're always out of the most common alcohol.  Whoever is in charge of inventory should be fired,  or trained by a professional who knows how to stock a bar. Absolutely ridiculous,  This has happened every single visit here.  This will definitely be my last time here.

Food: appetizers are small. You should probably get one each. Burgers are pretty good. The garlic seasoning is not worth the extra charge. Soft drinks are bottomless... Which brings me to another point. I took my kids. They are young. One got a float, one got a sprite. It would have been nice if the waitress asked before plopping another float in front of my son. I asked her to take it away, and she argued it was free refills. I told her I just didn't want my son having another. She kept arguing with me. Happily, my son just wanted a water and she left with the drinks.  Be aware, when you sit down, they point the kids to a tablet to order drinks and appetizers. What kid doesn't like a tablet. What kid wouldn't click the Games button on the tablet next. What kid would realize they just incurred a $1.99 Entertainment Fee. That's kind of BS. I argued it and after the third visit to pick up the check, they removed it.  Then there is the club. If you join the mailing list, you get some stupid points and the kids get a free dessert. I don't care about getting another junk mail so I said I would sign up. After they got their dessert, I had to go through the interview process. This isn't just giving your email. They want address, income, marital status, military status. Are they filing my taxes? I made up a bunch of garbage, got the bill, which defaults to 20% tip, unsubscribed from their list, and got out of there.  Won't be back.

Been here a dozen times before renovation and after renovation, staff is friendly and efficient.  I went there twice during the period they started using the little robin table wireless machine thing and it was a pain having to listen to them explain the purpose of the machine and how to use it but thankfully they caught on and stopped explaining the dam machine after the second visit. Nice lounge waiting area. On the weekends they blow up little red robin balloons and stack them in the front for kiddies. Sweet potato fries are not free btw. It's an upgrade.  If you want spicy, get the burger with the ghost chili but make sure you get the right size, they have a small version and a big version. They also have a burger with a jalapeño stuck on top which can be spicy too but it's not as incorporated into the burger as the ghost chili one.

Not a bad restaurant at all. Really enjoyed eating at this newly renovated location at Patriot Place. The wait was not that long at all, and we were notified when our table was ready via text message. (Neat-o!) Staff was helpful and kind. If it is your birthday, however this is the place to be! Staff will go out of their way to sing you a happy birthday, especially for a child. Wonderful place to take the family. Original cheeseburger was the perfect size, and comes with bottomless fries. (I was full after my first serving of fries! ;) ) Free drink refills. Also found it near how you could order your appetizers, shakes and desserts from a screen without even telling your server. Pretty cool technology at their newly renovated location next to Olympia Sports. Is pricey and somewhat expensive, but overall isn't a bad choice when you need a place to take your kid or whenever you are hungry.
First time at Red Robins was anything special and wasn't anything bad. It was average. I guess someone who is a burger fan I was expecting a little more. Service was great and food was just regular

I went here for the first time over the weekend, and I was pleasantly surprised. It was not crowded at all; our waitress, Samantha, was excellent, and my Southern Charm cheeseburger was the best burger I've had in a long time. We also had the onion ring appetizer, and that exceeded my expectations as well.

We decided to take a drive to Gillette Stadium this morning.  Walked around and checked out the shops.  Lunch time came and my husband suggested Red Robin, I was a bit hesitant because I have Celiac and thought they'd have nothing I could eat.  But I gave in and we gave it a try.  My Burger and Sweet potato fries were so yummy!  I was pleasantly surprised.  The wait staff were so friendly and attentive, the atmosphere was enlightening.  It was awesome!  Thank you!
Take way toooo long to get your food out. This place is located in a busy mall and here we were on a Friday night and after a 30 minute wait to he seated, we waited over an hour to get our burgers.

Used to be a really good place to go and get great food but Red Robin is terrible now. My last three visits have been terrible. Food is bad and service is worse. Management doesn't care about food allergies. When you specify that your kid had a severe allergy to dairy and they put cheese on his broccoli, the manager offers to remove the cheese from the broccoli. Zero concern about contamination and zero concern about possible allergic reaction. He said that cheese must have spilled onto the broccoli and that it wasn't a big deal. I'm usually pretty easy going but this was a real test. The food used to be great but it now tastes like school food and it isn't worth the time or the money. McDonald's is a much better choice
The wait staff was awesome and very attentive, but canned mushrooms on a $10.00 "gourmet" burger is unacceptable.

I was here the other night with my husband. It was my first time there since they moved a few spaces over. The new location is bigger and I thought it was a better set up than the previous location. I thought our server was great and the food was good as always. My husband tried a chicken sandwich there for the first time and he loved it! Said it was better than the burgers. I thought the prices for this place are great considering the location. I thought it would be over the top expensive, but it's not. We did have a bit of a wait, which was expected on a Saturday night. We were there about 6pm, but I felt it was worth it.  Will eat here again.

The food is OK but the waiter I had was ridiculous.  She didn't even give me a freaking straw after I asked for one.  The buns for the burger is so hard!!!!!!!!!!!!  Too hard!!!!!!!  The meat is burnt.  They have false advertising of fluffy and thick burgers.  My burgher is literally 3 inches.  The fruit punch tastes like water and on the salad there is something that looks like a pepper but tastes like cheese.

Red Robin is like many other typical American "mediocre" restaurants. They use a tremendous amount of fat, sugar and salt in their foods. The salad that my son ordered with chicken was drowning in chipotle ranch dressing, after we had requested it on the side. The sweet potato fries that came with my sandwich was about 2 ounces at most.  The service was slow and relatively unresponsive. They use those mini screens for helping you submit your orders and for entertainment. By the way the entertainment charge is two dollars to play a trivia game. Another rip off.  Doubtful that I'll return here anytime soon.  I'm not sure how these places survive.

Currently the weirdest experience of my life. Inattentive staff all in mix matched uniforms. Burger came out, very little fries (but they are bottomless so I'll let that go). Patty was cut in half, asked for "pink" was completely well done and the bun was stale. Bartender missed the two bite check one was making batches of some drink while another was flirting. The manager held a server meeting while sitting with someone I'm assuming is her significant other at the bar. All around super weird.

Take out review Red Robin Gourmet Burger at Gillette Stadium is everything you'd expect from the chain. Great tasting burger with fries. I had the royal red robin burger cooked medium with the fries subbed for onion rings. I enjoyed the meal. Same quality that I have had at other red robin restaurants.

Stopped in for dinner. Ordered a teriyaki chicken sandwich and a Mad Love burger. The chicken sandwich was pretty good but definitely not teriyaki.  The Mad Love burger did not have the same ingredients that the menu described.  It did have a burger patty lettuce tomato and onion. To spend $15 on a burger that comes out of the kitchen like this is a crime.  I had the waitress take the food away and remove it from the bill. It will be a long time before I choose Red Robin again.

Well first I  said no mayonnaise , and their was mayo on the burger. The kitchen clearly doesn't listen . The wait for ur server is laughable , just like everybody else said in heir reviews.  Burgers getting cold waiting for waitress to return and change it.  Not a well run operation

OK - so ever since red robin relocated to the other end of the strip it is obvious that they have seriously renovated things. The service is better, the food is great, and the new electronic checkout pads they have it make It so damn easy to pay and split the bill. My only recommendation is to sit at the bar if you're an adult because the kids here are relentless and you can be Damn sure they'll stick you and your date right next to that screeching family of 8.

I stopped by with my 4 yeat old daughter after visiting training camp. We were told by the hostess that it would be a 15 to 20 minute wait. After nearly half an hour of constantly assuring my daughter that we would be called any moment now and to just be patient, I finally inquired again as to when we would be seated. I was told by the same girl that it would probably be another 10 minutes. We chose to leave and find another place to eat instead.  Making people wait 40 minutes when they were initially told 15 to 20 minutes is a completely rude and unacceptable business practice in my book. We're not talking a couple of minutes here, we're talking twice as long. With all of the other options located in and around Patriot Place, a better dining experience can definitely be found elsewhere.

The food was ok, I got the black and blue burger but it was a little bit burnt. I have to say the service is hell... Like awful enough to keep me away for good. Took over 30 mins to get seated which is what it is... Very busy location. But the waitress OMG couldn't get out of her own way.  We asked for silverware and she said she couldn't do it? They were all out?? The burgers came with 6 French fries which is ok because they have "never ending fries" which they charge for sauces. We orders more fries and after 20 mins she came back and said "ya so the kitchen forgot... It would be another 15 mins.. Do you still want them?"  At this point of course we were done, and had been there forever! Awful awful service and manors at this place I was shocked. We will not be back.

Wandered over to Red Robin on a busy day at the stadium, UMass football & soccer on same day.  Immediately seated outside by a very nice hostess.   Server came by right away to greet us and take our drink orders and the great service continued until we left.  Food came amazingly fast and exactly as ordered.  Terrific burgers, cold beer and wine.   Have to note that the wine serving was on the light side.  That was the only nit.  Otherwise, it was exactly as it should be for a super casual, burger joint.   First visit to a Red Robin and it won't be our last.
Came here a few years ago, thought it was alright at best.  Recently tried it again, fantastic! Been there 4 times in the last month and a half.

Been awhile. They moved to the opposite end of Patriots place. Now near the stadium. Fish burger and bonzi burger doesnt have as much meat as it used to. Or more bread. Friendly service. Great job supporting the Special Olympics.

For a burger that five guys can serve better the price was a bit out of line. Without competition in this market the chain must have done very well. But now there are many people serving equal food or better and at a better price.

Fantastic food and service from Mollie.  First time at this location amd definitely will return!  Milk shakes are amazing and Root Beer float was top notch!  Definitely ask for our server when you come!

I wouldn't exactly call them "gourmet" but they're good -- we went there before a movie and were in a bit of a rush. They got us in and out in record time. We loved playing trivia at the table, and we could even pay the bill quickly via the machine at the table so we didn't waste more time. I enjoyed my mac and cheese (burnt bread crumbs were actually a nice touch!) and my boyfriend enjoyed his angus burger (8oz). If you're in the area and want something more casual before movies or shopping, I'd recommend it as a good option. Menchies was also yummy to follow!

3 stars because the service was really good but my salad came out with a fly in it, I know that happens but it's still gross and makes you think how the kitchen looks. This place was better inside when it was at its old location the new place isn't as welcoming inside.

The only reason I give this location a 1 star is for the kitchen managers attempt at redeeming a bad meal other wise I would give this location a negative star. When my boyfriend and I were shown to our table I brought to the attention of the host (quietly) that the table was dirty. He quickly brushed off crumbs and walked away and I caught his attention again and pointed out the crumbs and again dusted them off. When we our waitress came we ordered drinks and a appetizer (pretzel bites) and placed our food order (banzai and pepper burgers well done). The pretzels were brought to the table by another individuals and appetizer plates were dropped off and they were dirty. The staff seemed to have disappeared for 10 min then our burgers were delivered. Both burgers were undercooked and bright pink inside. When the waitress came back I explained that the food was not cooked through and we were ready to leave. This is when she got the manager who was great trying to redeem the restaurant. We however were put off and not interested in new burgers. In the past we have gotten tasty burgers at clean tables. I hope that this was a rare occurrence but being as slow as it was tonight at the restaurant it's hard to believe it was.

My first time at a Red Robin and I loved it. I tried the top of the line gourmet burger, the Billion Dollar Baby and it was delicious (see picture). The garlic fries and aioli garlic sauce were a great companion. The burger selection will keep me coming back. The service was also top notch as they helped this old guy work through the club sign up and pad ordering system.

Red Robin..... yum! More like Red Robin ......so so!  We went there last night for the first time.  We ordered two "gourmet" burgers. Mine was the BBQ bacon burger. I was very disappointed with the lack of real flavor of the burger . I asked for medium and it was well done. Very dry burger. I don't know how you can a have burger with so much stuff on it but no real flavor . The onion rings were big but they gave me 5 of them and they were over cooked. We also have chili cheese fries. Again they we ok but the chili was straight out of a can. I could of made them better at home.  We hand two whisky sours and that  was the best part of the meal. $65.00 with tip. Worth about half that much. I would give them one more chance and try the chicken.  Oh and the bathroom was a mess with no toilet paper and no paper towels.

Always loved this place especially for their fries however that has all changed based on one bad experience  Wife had eaten  half of her chicken burger only to find it totally raw.  We alerted management and they wrote up a case report.   He offered to cook another one but as you can imagine it was not what my wife wanted so he comped the burger.   Was expecting that someone would call the next day or at worse case a week later Tom find out if my wife was all right.   My wife instead called their head and basically got no satisfaction.  Giving two stars as I still think their are the best around!

my fiance and i had a quick dinner here last night, and our experience played out exactly as it should have. we received prompt and courteous service at the bar, our food came out quickly and correctly, and we were in and out in about 40 minutes.  we each had an arnold palmer which wasn't too sweet.  i had a cup of clam chowder which i suspect is not actually made there, but was standard fare and nothing to complain about.  we each had a banzai burger, and my doneness request of "pink," surprisingly, actually was, which has not been my experience at other red robin locations.  fries were hot and crisp, and the truly homemade ranch dressing was delicious per usual. with all the options as patriot place, red robin may not necessarily become a go-to, but it definitely delivered on this occasion.
Pretty solid hamburger here, typical of the other locations I suspect. It can be loud inside and it's kid friendly. Nevertheless good food and drink that won't break your wallet. Thanks Red Robin!

Added our name to the wait list, received a text saying the estimated wait time was 50 minutes. After and hour and 15 minutes, I asked where we were on the list. They looked at their list, and both employees had the "oh $h!t" look on their faces. So they then rushed to seat us. The waiter took our order, brought out our food and drinks, and never checked on us. We had to search for him. Needless to say, last time we will be going there
The hostess was very rude to us so we didn't even get past her. Decided to take my party elsewhere

I didn't even get into the place.  The hostess was so incredibly rude and was put off by my questions that i sat down then called other places on the property.  I will tell ya 2 servers on for lunchtime without even an apology....  so very poor.  If she had answered my questions i would have waited the 20 to 30 min quoted.  Her attitude stunk.  Will not go back.  Hostess is first impression
Great food and very quick survive!! Every 5 minutes or so they come by and give you another basket of fries. Very cheap too. And you have a beautiful view of Gillette Stadium, what beats that!?

Went to Red Robin with my wife on a Saturday night at Patriots Place.  Most of the restaurants there were packed with really long waits, so we decided to grab a burger at Red Robin.  I suppose the fact that we got a seat right away is an indicator of either how popular this is, or the fact that it is around the back of the main path through Patriots Place I got a black and blue burger and my wife got the bbq burger.  The food came reasonably quickly.  They forgot to put the barbeque sauce on the burger, but we flagged down the waitress and she brought it out quickly.  The burgers tasted OK. For some reason the little screen that has games on it (for extra money) seems kind of visually annoying.  Our server was OK, not particularly attentive.  The menu said something about endless fries, but we never got offered - and probably I really didn't need more anyway. They set things up so that if you don't order dessert the server just tells you to check yourself out on the screen.  I guess it is efficient, but it doesn't leave you feeling like personal service is a priority for them.

Very disappointed overall with this place. Upon being seated we were greeted in a timely fashion, but we could tell the waiter, "P", didn't really want to be there. The food was ok, nothing great. The "endless" fries are a joke. What they've done is reduced the number of fries that go out ( I had 8 on my plate) and then the staff conveniently disappears until people are mostly done... thus avoiding a request for more fries. Prices were reasonable, hence the two stars. Next time we'll just go over to Five Guys.

That's the worst place visited ever. 15 minutes waiting for the waitress to take our order, ( and the place is not busy ), service plain and rude ; we order a soup for my wife ( she found a small hair on the her soup , and the manager told us " this is normal ") , we also order two kids meals for my boys and the side carrots and the brócolis looks very old , my beer is warm and my burger is under cook and smaller than a regular cheese burger at Mc Donald's , i account 4 steak fries only on my plate. Strongly not recommended for any one ... if you like spending your money on a poor restaurant... this is the best spot !!! Never coming back !!! For shore !!! To the great final we run on the restroom... my friend ... if you not believe how dirty is please contact me , because I take a picture and I can show you how dirty and nasty this place is ...

You would figure a place that is basically a burger restaurant would actually have something other than frozen 1/4 pound hamburger patties.  Went last night and ordered the Pig Out Tavern burger and it was just 2 frozen burger patties. Very disappointing how about actually using ground beef and forming patties instead of prying apart frozen patties and heating them up

Visited here on a Saturday and there was an event that night so double whammy.    You would think for restaurants in that complex, since we had stopped at another restaurant prior to find out a wait time...they would have more organized system on trying to take names and give wait times.      People are trying to push their door to get in and not letting the people out that have finished dining.   I get customers could be less rude but I believe it's hard with that amount of foot traffic.    Couldn't you on the nice days set up a kiosk outside or put a sign with the estimated wait time ?    That might deter some of the congestion since some people only walk in to find a wait time.      My party was able to sit at the bar since we have no kids with us.    The bartenders were attentive and our food arrived really fast.     We all ordered another round of fries and those took longer to come out than our hamburgers the first time.     If you go here looking for fancy, you'll be disappointed.     It's good for a quick meal before an event.   Or if you just want a quick lunch/dinner so you can keep shopping.

This is the dirtiest Red Robin ever. Servers don't really care either. They are nice but shrug things off. We came here cause my 6 year old wanted to. She remembers cleaner Red Robin's. This was our first time here but I won't be back. That's for sure!

Packed Red Robin in Patriot Place at supper time. Staff was well prepared for everyone and did their best to upsell and ask the right questions for kids meals (2 little ones ended up sharing fries but had their own apple slices).  The Madlove Burger, Whiskey River® BBQ Chicken Wrap and Veggie burger for the adults were all made to order and obviously enjoyed since no one left an empty plate. The kids ended up with their own hamburger meals and left their plates empty as well. My only problem was the fries - I forgot to ask for no seasoning, so the steak fries came loaded with salt, pepper and whatever else they put on it. A shared dessert of the Mountain High Mudd Pie was big enough to split between 5 people, although I think the children enjoyed it more!  I do have to say, this was a better experience than what I had in the Florida location I went to. Although I found out there is a $1.99 charge for games on the computers they leave at the tables, I would think about coming back again if I were ever back in Foxboro.

Went there today for dinner and sat at the bar. Food was decent as usual and reasonably priced, but service was awful.  The bartender was inattentive when there were never more than four guests including us at the bar. She took ten minutes after our food arrived to give us silverware. The sad part is this isn't the first time we have had lackluster service there from her. I don't know if I can return, which is sad since I live in the area.

I'm shocked this place only gets 2.5 stars. We usually sit in the bar area, which has very comfortable seats and lots of high top tables. The service is fantastic, and we've never had a bad meal there. Its not a 5-star restaurant like Davio's, but one of the best burger joints you're going to find. Their big salads are excellent too, and the drinks are just fine. If you're looking for a good burger, you won't go wrong here.

Be aware. It says they close at 11 on the weekends but we were told by the bartender when we went in at 1030 on Friday night that they "close early on concert nights" my guess is they didn't want the late concert crowd but it was 1030 and about 8 people were turned away within 10 minutes...

If you get anything but the burgers you will be disappointed.  My wife got the soup and salad comprised of a Caesar wrap (no Romain) and Chili which had apparently evaporated all the liquid from sitting around.  The fries were good.  Did I mention the burgers were excellent?   Prices were high.  This was my first visit so I might try it again.
The burgers were really good! It's a fun place to take the kids for dinner. My server Bella was awesome. Definitely recommend!
Just not very good fries were cold. Portion of fries was small. Burger was just ok. Atmosphere was not the best very packed in 5 guys is better half the price

I went last weekend with my wife and son. The place was a little busy, but plenty of open tables. We had gone to another Red Robin on vacation and really enjoyed it so we wanted to go back.  The hostess brought us to our table and we instead asked for a booth. She mumbled something about the server and said we needed to sit at the table. When my wife pulled out her chair it was covered with pieces of food, as was the table top. My wife asked for a napkin to clean the table and the hostess said, "just sit at the booth". No acknowledgement of the mess or apology for how bad the floors looked, etc. She obviously didn't care. The floors were a mess covered with pieces of food, and during our hour or so there nobody came by to clean the table in question, sweep up, or did any cleaning. If a manager had come by I would have pointed out the mess. The place is poorly managed  and the staff untrained. The waitress was pleasant but getting fries and another ice tea took a while. The burgers were good but overall not worth the price given the experience. Won't be back. Cleanliness matters, just not at this place.

Hello, my name is Genyphurre, and this is my story. I sat down with my Sister and Deux comrades in this establishment, and i was perky and ready to snub a grub. My friend order a surplus of soft drinks, wild gal! To help her out, i started vigorously SHOVELING it into my esophagus. My Ginger Friend, toolooleigh, made a big fat roast!! It was so funny, that the soft drink got lodged in my windpipe, and made a dramatic excursion into my nasal cavity. Suddenly, i could not breathe. I started flailing, and sequenched my entire body as a coping mechanism. I started flailing my limbs, and doing a little choking jig. One of the waitresses spotted me, but thought i was just straight jamming, having a good time! I was not. Soon after, the soft drink ejected itself from every hole in my body. I was fine, but left with severe PTSD. Every time i see something red, i have a brain spasm. My best friends name was robin, until i had to cease all contact to avoid risk of an aneurism. Thank you for your time.
I love the black and blue burger. My husband prefers the mushroom one. The bar area is our favorite place or weather permitting the outside patio.

Went on a busy night and sat in the bar area. The food was just like all other Red Robin's but the server was very attentive especially for the bar area of a resturant. Definitely made the night enjoyable.
